intro: Quasiantennaria, commonly known as the featherleaf daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants are characterized by their slender, grass-like leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. Quasiantennaria species are typically low-growing and have a compact, mat-forming habit. They are often used in rock gardens and dry landscapes due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
